page.description: A step-by-step guide to building your first web application using Alpha Anywhere's Flying Start Genie.

description.p: This tutorial assumes you have already completed [Setting Up a Workspace] to create a blank workspace with a connection string to the Northwind database.
Have you completed [Setting Up a Workspace]? If your answer to this question is no, please follow the [Setting Up a Workspace] tutorial before starting this tutorial.

group.title: First Things First: Setting Up Your Workspace

description.p: The Flying Start Genie is a tool that can help you to build a web application quickly. The Flying Start Genie generates a set of Grid Components for viewing, editing, and searching selected tables from a database. The generated components are placed in a Tabbed UI Component, which can be published immediately after completing the Flying Start Genie. Using the Flying Start Genie is a great way to start building a web application.

step.description: From the *[ui:Web Projects Control panel]*, click *[ui:[FileAdd] Add File]*.
On the *[ui:Connect to Database]* tab, set the connection string. Select *[ui:SQL Database]* and click the *[ui:Define Connection String]* to open the Connection String dialog.

description.p: Select *[ui:Use a named connection string]*. Click the *[ui:Select...]* button and select the *[Northwind]* connection string. The Flying Start Genie requires a named connection string. If you do not have a named connection string for the Northwind database, follow Lesson 2 in in [Setting Up a Workspace] to create a named Northwind connection string.

step.description: Click *[ui:OK]* to set the connection string. Click *[ui:Next >]* to move to the next step in the Flying Start Genie.

The Flying Start Genie creates Grid Components for a set of tables or views that you pick from the selected database. Step 2, *[ui:Select Tables]*, is where you pick the tables. By default, views and tables are listed. The options chosen can be filtered. Click *[ui:Filter available object types]* to open the Filter Table/View List dialog.
In the Filter Table/View List dialog, uncheck the option for "Views". This will remove views from list of options for *[ui:Select Tables]*.
Click the *[ui:[SelectAll]]* Select All button to select all of the tables in the Northwind database. A Grid Component will be created for each selected table. Click *[ui:Next >]*.

The *[ui:Global Properties]* tab is where you can view and edit the Global Settings for the Flying Start Genie. The Global Settings are the default settings used to generate the Grid Components for the tables you selected on the *[ui:Select Tables]* page. Check the *[ui:Show Global Settings]* box to explose the Global Settings.
The Default Properties listed dictate how the Grid, Search, and Detail View part are generated.

Change the *[ui:Grid name prefix]* in the Grid Part settings to *[Northwind_]*. This will prefix the name of the Grid Components generated for the selected tables with "Northwind_". Click *[ui:Next >]*.

On the *[ui:Finish]* page, you will see a summary of the tables the Flying Start Genie will use to create Grid Components. A Tabbed UI Component will also be created. A button to open each Grid Component will be added to the Tabbed UI Component. There is a checkbox above the table list, "Publish files to the 'Live Preview' folder and open the Tabbed UI component in your browser?". If this box is checked, all files created by the Flying Start Genie will be published to localhost and the web browser will be launched. Leave this box checked and click *[ui:Next >]*.
You will be asked if you want to save the Flying Start Genie settings. Click *[ui:Yes]* to save the settings.
Name the Flying Start Genie settings *[Northwind]* and click *[ui:OK]*.
A Notice will appear after you save the Flying Start Genie settings. Depending on the number of tables and settings, generating the Grid and Tabbed UI components can take a while. Click *[ui:OK]*.

The Wait dialog shows the Flying Start Genie progress. As each Grid Component is created, the progress bar will be updated. When the Flying Start Genie is done creating the Grid and Tabbed UI Components, the Wait dialog will automatically close. Leave this window alone until the Flying Start Genie completes the component generation.
If the Alpha Anywhere Develpoment Server is not running, you will be prompted to start the server. Click *[ui:Yes]* to start the Development Server.
The Development Server will ask you if you want to start the server. Click *[ui:Yes]*.

Next, a small window will appear asking if you would like to perform a *[ui:Live Preview]* or *[ui:Remote Test]*. You will perform a *[ui:Live Preview]*. Select *[ui:Live Preview]*. This will launch your web browser and load the .a5w page containing the Tabbed UI Component that was created by the Flying Start Genie.
